<topcClas>Specific diseases and medical conditions - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>Agriculture, forestry and rural industry - Industry and management</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>World Bank Africa Development Indicators</i> (ADI) provides annual time series data for over 1,400 indicators. Topics covered by the extensive database include national accounts, balance of payments, trade, prices, government finance and external debt with data on household welfare (from the Survey-based Harmonized  Indicators Program), demography, health, education, the regulatory environment, communications, transport, energy and the environment. The ADI data cover the period 1960 to the latest available year for 53 countries and 5 regional country groups.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the databases is: World Bank (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Africa Development Indicators (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/wb/adi/2009-01">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/wb/adi/2009-01</a>}</i>. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Basic Indicators and National Accounts:<ul><li>basic indicators</li><li>balance of payment statistics (BOPS)</li><li>debt</li><li>global finance statistics (GFS)</li><li>money</li><li>national accounts</li><li>prices</li></ul>Development Outcomes:<ul><li>agriculture and rural development</li><li>doing business</li><li>drivers of growth</li><li>governance and partnership</li><li>HIV/AIDS</li><li>human development</li><li>infrastructure</li><li>investment climate</li><li>labour, migration and population</li><li>malaria</li><li>national accounts</li><li>population</li><li>private sector development</li><li>protected areas</li><li>trade</li></ul>Millennium Development Goals:<ul><li>Millennium Development Goal 1: Eradicate extreme poverty and hunger</li><li>Millennium Development Goal 2: Achieve universal primary education</li><li> Millennium Development Goal 3: Promote gender equity and empower women</li><li> Millennium Development Goal 4: Reduce child mortality</li><li>Millennium Development Goal 5: Improve maternal health</li><li>Millennium Development Goal 6: Combat HIV/AIDS, malaria, and other diseases</li><li>Millennium Development Goal 7: Ensure environmental sustainability</li><li>Millennium Development Goal 8: Develop a global partnership for development</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The Africa Development Indicators contain annual time series data from 1960 to the latest available year.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>53 countries and 5 regional country groups: Algeria, Angola, Arab Republic of Egypt, Benin, Botswana, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cameroon, Cape Verde, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo (People's Republic), C\ufffd\ufffdte D'ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Kenya, Lesotho, Liberia, Libya, Madagascar (1977- ), Malawi, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Morocco, Mozambique, Namibia, Niger, Nigeria, Rwanda, S\ufffd\ufffdo Tom\ufffd\ufffd And Principe, Senegal, Seychelles, Sierra Leone, Somalia, South Africa, Sudan, Swaziland, Tanzania, Togo, Tunisia, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details.</sampProc>         <collMode>The World Bank web site has a <a href="http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/DATASTATISTICS/0,,menuPK:232599~pagePK:64133170~piPK:64133498~theSitePK:239419,00.html " title=" Data and Statistics"> Data and Statistics</a> section which includes information about the data, methodology, definitions, country classifications and technical notes. Please see the 'Definition entries for selected countries and series' link in the <a href=" http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/africa-indicators.aspx" title=" World Bank WDI dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a>.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>As a result of the World Bank's Open Data initiative the World Bank datasets hosted by the UK Data Service are freely available to all. Please refer to the <a href="http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/0,,contentMDK:22547097~pagePK:50016803~piPK:50016805~theSitePK:13,00.html" title="Terms of Use for Datasets">Terms of Use for Datasets</a> in The World Bank's Data Catalog.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>4813 World Bank International Debt Statistics, 1970-2013 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4814 World Bank World Development Indicators, 1960-2013 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
